comment.author: 59345609@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/13423385@N03] Although i am not from Malawi, i do believe you are right. The guys just wrote down stuff without cross checking

comment.author: 60406173@N04
comment._content: It wasn't a question of cross-checking, the caption is correct.  It's just that; in some people's handwriting, as was obviously the case here, 'n's and 'u's can look the same.  The Mang'anja, who live in the Lower Shire valley, are part of the ChiChewa/ChiNyan,ja speaking Maravi who, coming from the west, moved into central and southern Malawi in the 15th/16th centuries.
